folder: Hudson Street & Laight Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Hudson Street, east side, south from Laight to Beach St's., showing the westerly side of the St. John's Freight Terminal, erected in 1868. It was demolished about 1930 and a new terminal erected between West and Washington Streets, above Canal Street.

About 1915


H. N. Tiemann, photo
Gift of Urbrock Collection

folder: Hudson Street & Laight Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Hudson Street, west side, south from but not including Laight Street, showing freight traine of the New York Central Railroad outside the St. John's freight depot (at left, hardly visible). March 6, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Hudson Street & Laight Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Hudson Street, west side, north from Laight Street, showing a steam engine of the New York Central Railroad.
March 7, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Hudson Street & Laight Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Nos. 163-151 Hudson Street, west side, south from Laight (right) to Hubert (left) Streets. December 5, 1936. P. L. Sperr.  Neg. # 4711

(2) Nos. 163-157 Hudson Street, at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Laight Street. No. 157 is the 3-story building. December 5, 1936. P. L. Sperr.  Neg. # 4712
